title: Front Brake Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: HF7; HJ7; HH7; HG7; HE7; HD7 (do not use - delete if found in use); HDA; HD6; HD5; HD4; HD2; HD

body.body: Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Front Brake Master Cylinder Removal HD2 HD5 HD6

To drain the fluid from the master cylinder, attach a tube to the right hand caliper bleed nipple, loosen the nipple and allow the fluid to drain into a suitable container. Operate the brake lever until all fluid has been expelled.
Note the position of the brake light switch for installation.
Disconnect from the master cylinder the:
Release the clamp screws from the handlebar to remove the master cylinder assembly.
